intro: Aegilops dichasians, commonly known as the two-rowed wild barley, is a wild relative of cultivated barley. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is native to the Mediterranean region. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of two rows of spikelets, giving it its common name. It is valued for its genetic diversity and potential use in breeding programs to improve crop resilience.
